title: Premier League announce plans to break 3pm blackout rule for Manchester City vs Leeds
body_text:
The Premier League has announced Manchester City’s rearranged fixture against Leeds could be broadcast live on Sky Sports despite the 3pm blackout rule.
Manchester City’s progression to the semi-finals of the Champions League means their home fixture against Leeds United has been brought forward a day from May 7 to May 6.
Advertisement
The match between City and Leeds is still due to be shown live on Sky Sports in the UK despite the blackout rule, which is also known as Article 48.
The Premier League have said the match cannot kick off at 12.30pm due to the King’s coronation which is taking place on the same day and starts at 11am.
The blackout rule has been in place since the 1960s and prohibits matches from being shown between 2.45 pm and 5.15 pm on a Saturday to protect attendances throughout the EFL and all divisions below the Premier League.
Saturday at 3 pm is the traditional kick-off time for all weekend games in the United Kingdom.
It is designed to help clubs who rely on gate receipts as opposed to TV deals for the majority of their revenue.
The rule was dropped when football resumed after the coronavirus pandemic due to fans being unable to attend games inside stadiums.
Premier League chief Richard Masters said in March that there were no plans to drop the blackout rule.
“We’ve been proponents of Article 48 for the entire period of the Premier League and I don’t see that changing in the near term,” Masters said.
The Premier League said the game being broadcast on Sky Sports is “subject to further consultation with relevant stakeholders regarding Article 48”. UEFA and other leagues in England’s football pyramid will be consulted.
The Premier League also confirmed the date and kick-off time for Manchester City’s away match against Brighton & Hove Albion with the fixture now scheduled for Wednesday, May 24.
Manchester United will host Chelsea a day later on Thursday, May 25.
Erik ten Hag’s side were due to host Chelsea this weekend but the fixture had to be postponed due to United’s FA Cup commitments.
United face Brighton & Hove Albion at the semi-final stage of the FA Cup at Wembley on Sunday which meant their fixture against Chelsea had to be pushed back.
Advertisement
It means the two sides will now go head to head just three days before the Premier League campaign comes to an end on May 28.
United host Fulham on the final day of the season while Chelsea entertain Newcastle United.
West Ham’s away trip to Brentford has been pushed back a day to May 14 due to the fact the east London side remain in the Europa Conference League.
New dates and KO times
Manchester City vs Leeds United – Saturday May 6 (3pm KO – Sky Sports)
Brentford vs West Ham United – Sunday May 14 (2pm KO)
Brighton vs Manchester City – Wednesday May 24 (8pm KO – Sky Sports)
Manchester United vs Chelsea – Thursday May 25 (8pm KO – Sky Sports)
